attributes.action:
Changes in knife and Gun laws.
Government to invest back into communities
attributes.additional_details:
Too many young children are being killed. The current laws are not working. Children are not safe. 

The current services, youth organisations have limited funding and support putting our young children at a detriment to succeed. There is a need for more opportunities for our young children to excel and funding has to be put back into all communities.
attributes.background:
Review knife and Gun Laws.
Find solutions to stop killings and to reinvest back into the communities and organisations for our young children, giving them opportunities to excel.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about knife and gun crime, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Create a dedicated Minister for Knife Crime Prevention: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/639631

Mandatory 10-year sentence for possession of a knife: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/636853

Impose minimum sentences for first offence of possession of a knife: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/635897

Minimum sentence of 5 years for carrying a knife with a minimum fine of £10k: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/642085

Increase funding for youth organisations across the county: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/638630
